jobDescription: Description  The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following  Provide strong scientific problem-solving skills  Exhibits a strong desire, working with various teams, to develop a fundamental understanding of key technical parameters coupled to strong ability to articulate key findings. All efforts supported by data.  Plan and implement the development of complex coating science  Monitor personal metrics and objectives ensuring meeting of goals  Maintain a safe work environment and follow all safety regulations  Develop strategies to increase R&D; capabilities  Support the implementation of the quality plan and quality control plans for R&D; functions  Supervises the laboratory equipment calibration management activities Qualifications In order to be qualified for this role, you must possess the following  A minimum of Ph.D. degree in a relevant field such as Polymer chemistry, Inorganic chemistry, Materials Science or equivalent; and a minimum of five years of experience in a directly relevant setting.  Utilize strong organizational skill cross discipline knowledge, communication and multitasking  The following skill sets are preferred by the business unit  Knowledge of radiation therapy  Knowledge of FDA medical device regulation
